page.title: 20MASHAM'S COTTAGE-TILEGATE
page.content: S.W. corner:{510090}The hamlet of TILEGATE GREEN straddles the by-road running east towards HIGH LAVER. The huge grainfields characteristic of arable farming in the mid 1980's stretch far on either side. Many of the farms & houses here date back over centuries & are much cared for by the owners. One such is Mr. Shuttleworth the owner of MASHAMS a delightful thatched wattle & daub cottage possibly once belonging to a yeoman farmer. Long-term subsidence is posing some threat as the adjacent pond, possibly either the remains of a moat or merely the hole left after removal of clay for building. The cottage was bought in 1925 for Â£360 and now some 60 years later could well bring Â£90,000 plus. Mr. Shuttleworth is hoping that MASHAMS will possibly become a museum eventually.
